@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@ +Prototype +========= + +This is the prototype development section of the Linux ACL Management Project. After long discussions with Robert Tweedy and Mahmoud Zeydabadinezhad, development of prototype was decided. This codebase is where I experiment with designs and methods that were discussed, solve occuring problems, prove my design decisions, etc. while my mentors guide me and correct when I deviate from the requirements. This will ensure that I better understand all the requirements before starting with the final project. + +Note that since we haven’t came up with coding practices, styles and rules, I am building it on my own judgement. Although, I am making sure to follow necessary practices since a lot of code from this repository is going to lay the base for components in the final project. + +.. toctree::

    •    <article role="main" id="furo-main-content">

    •      <section id="prototype">

    +

    Prototype¶

    +

    This is the prototype development section of the Linux ACL Management Project. After long discussions with Robert Tweedy and Mahmoud Zeydabadinezhad, development of prototype was decided. This codebase is where I experiment with designs and methods that were discussed, solve occuring problems, prove my design decisions, etc. while my mentors guide me and correct when I deviate from the requirements. This will ensure that I better understand all the requirements before starting with the final project.

    +

    Note that since we haven’t came up with coding practices, styles and rules, I am building it on my own judgement. Although, I am making sure to follow necessary practices since a lot of code from this repository is going to lay the base for components in the final project.

    +
    +
    + +

    •    </article>

    @@ -0,0 +1,12 @@ +Prototype +========= + +Link to Prototype Repository: https://github.com/PythonHacker24/linux-acl-management + +This is the prototype development section of the Linux ACL Management Project. After long discussions with Robert Tweedy and Mahmoud Zeydabadinezhad, development of prototype was decided. This codebase is where I experiment with designs and methods that were discussed, solve occuring problems, prove my design decisions, etc. while my mentors guide me and correct when I deviate from the requirements. This will ensure that I better understand all the requirements before starting with the final project. + +Note that since we haven’t came up with coding practices, styles and rules, I am building it on my own judgement. Although, I am making sure to follow necessary practices since a lot of code from this repository is going to lay the base for components in the final project. + +.. toctree::
